page.title: 09FARMING IN DALRY(KIRK)
page.content: The average farm covers 300 acres and produces store sheep, breeding sheep and store cattle. The sheep are mainly Blackfaced/Blue Leicester crosses but there are two small pedigree Blue Leicester flocks. Most of the cows have Galloway and Hereford blood and can stay out, feeding calves, all year round but increasingly stock is being overwintered in sheds.Home produced hay, silage,barley,oats,rape and root crops supplement the grazing. The cows are served by a continental breed of bull such as a Charolais. In the autumn both store sheep and cattle are sold at auction for finishing on better ground,while much of the breeding stock is sold to farms in England and Wales.
